702616f-b.title: Brooklyn: 18th Avenue - 83rd Street
702616f-b.text:
(1)
Eighteenth Ave., east side, at the N.E. corner of 83rd Street ; show-
ing the New Utrecht Dutch Reformed Church, built in 1828, on site of
the old New Utrecht schoolhouse, dedicated in 1829. The church was
organized in 1677 in the schoolhouse. The services were held in
private dwellinge. A Church was erected in the Dutch burying ground,
in 1700, at what is now the N.E. corner of Sixteenth Ave., and 84th
Street. A local minister was installed in 1809.
February 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same; showing a side of the church.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same; showing the front door of the Church.
1922.
Eugene W. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
